verses.kjv: Then wrought Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whom the LORD put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all manner of work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that the LORD had commanded.
verses.ct: So Bezaleel and Aholiab got to work, along with every skilled craftsman to whom the LORD had given wisdom and understanding for carrying out all the construction of the sanctuary, exactly as the LORD had instructed.

verses.kjv: And Moses called Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whose heart the LORD had put wisdom, even every one whose heart stirred him up to come unto the work to do it:
verses.ct: Moses summoned Bezaleel and Aholiab, together with every skilled person whose heart the LORD had filled with wisdom — everyone who felt compelled to come and do the work.

verses.kjv: And they received of Moses all the offering, which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, to make it withal. And they brought yet unto him free offerings every morning.
verses.ct: They collected from Moses all the contributions that the Israelites had donated for constructing the sanctuary. But the people kept bringing voluntary gifts every morning.

verses.kjv: And all the wise men, that wrought all the work of the sanctuary, came every man from his work which they made;
verses.ct: Eventually, all the skilled workers who were doing the various tasks on the sanctuary each stopped what they were working on

verses.kjv: And they spake unto Moses, saying, The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work, which the LORD commanded to make.
verses.ct: and told Moses, "The people are bringing far more than what's needed for the project that the LORD ordered us to complete."

verses.kjv: And Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, Let neither man nor woman make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary. So the people were restrained from bringing.
verses.ct: So Moses issued an order, and an announcement was sent throughout the camp: "No one — man or woman — should prepare anything else as a contribution for the sanctuary." That stopped the people from bringing more.

verses.kjv: For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.
verses.ct: The materials they already had were more than enough to finish all the work.

verses.kjv: And every wise hearted man among them that wrought the work of the tabernacle made ten curtains of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: with cherubims of cunning work made he them.
verses.ct: The most skilled craftsmen among the workers constructed the tabernacle using 10 curtains of finely woven linen in blue, purple, and scarlet, with figures of cherubim expertly woven into them.

verses.kjv: The length of one curtain was twenty and eight cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: the curtains were all of one size.
verses.ct: Each curtain measured 42 feet long and 6 feet wide — all the curtains were identical in size.

verses.kjv: And he coupled the five curtains one unto another: and the other five curtains he coupled one unto another.
verses.ct: He joined 5 curtains together as one set, and the other 5 curtains together as a second set.

verses.kjv: And he made loops of blue on the edge of one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling: likewise he made in the uttermost side of another curtain, in the coupling of the second.
verses.ct: He attached loops of blue fabric along the edge of the last curtain in the first set, and did the same along the edge of the last curtain in the second set.

verses.kjv: Fifty loops made he in one curtain, and fifty loops made he in the edge of the curtain which was in the coupling of the second: the loops held one curtain to another.
verses.ct: He put 50 loops on one curtain and 50 loops on the matching edge of the other curtain, so the loops lined up with each other.

verses.kjv: And he made fifty taches of gold, and coupled the curtains one unto another with the taches: so it became one tabernacle.
verses.ct: Then he made 50 gold clasps and fastened the two sets of curtains together with them, making the tabernacle one unified structure.

verses.kjv: And he made curtains of goats’ hair for the tent over the tabernacle: eleven curtains he made them.
verses.ct: He also made curtains of goat hair as an outer tent over the tabernacle — 11 curtains in all.

verses.kjv: The length of one curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits was the breadth of one curtain: the eleven curtains were of one size.
verses.ct: Each of these curtains measured 45 feet long and 6 feet wide — all 11 were the same size.

verses.kjv: And he coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.
verses.ct: He joined 5 of the curtains into one group and the remaining 6 into another group.

verses.kjv: And he made fifty loops upon the uttermost edge of the curtain in the coupling, and fifty loops made he upon the edge of the curtain which coupleth the second.
verses.ct: He attached 50 loops along the outer edge of the last curtain in the first group, and 50 loops along the edge of the last curtain in the second group.

verses.kjv: And he made fifty taches of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be one.
verses.ct: He made 50 bronze clasps to fasten the tent sections together into a single unit.

verses.kjv: And he made a covering for the tent of rams’ skins dyed red, and a covering of badgers’ skins above that.
verses.ct: He made a covering for the tent out of ram skins dyed red, with an additional covering of fine leather over that.

verses.kjv: And he made boards for the tabernacle of shittim wood, standing up.
verses.ct: He constructed upright frames for the tabernacle out of acacia wood.

verses.kjv: The length of a board was ten cubits, and the breadth of a board one cubit and a half.
verses.ct: Each frame was 15 feet long and 27 inches wide.

verses.kjv: One board had two tenons, equally distant one from another: thus did he make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
verses.ct: Each frame had 2 pegs spaced evenly apart. He made all the frames for the tabernacle this way.

verses.kjv: And he made boards for the tabernacle; twenty boards for the south side southward:
verses.ct: He made frames for the tabernacle: 20 frames for the south side.

verses.kjv: And forty sockets of silver he made under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for his two tenons, and two sockets under another board for his two tenons.
verses.ct: He made 40 silver bases to go under the 20 frames — 2 bases under each frame, one for each peg.

verses.kjv: And for the other side of the tabernacle, which is toward the north corner, he made twenty boards,
verses.ct: For the north side of the tabernacle, he also made 20 frames

verses.kjv: And their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
verses.ct: with their 40 silver bases — 2 bases under each frame.

verses.kjv: And for the sides of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.
verses.ct: For the back of the tabernacle on the west side, he made 6 frames.

verses.kjv: And two boards made he for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides.
verses.ct: He made 2 additional frames for the back corners of the tabernacle.

verses.kjv: And they were coupled beneath, and coupled together at the head thereof, to one ring: thus he did to both of them in both the corners.
verses.ct: These corner frames were joined at the bottom and connected all the way up to a single ring at the top. He did this for both corners.

verses.kjv: And there were eight boards; and their sockets were sixteen sockets of silver, under every board two sockets.
verses.ct: So there were 8 frames with their 16 silver bases — 2 bases under each frame.

verses.kjv: And he made bars of shittim wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
verses.ct: He made crossbars of acacia wood — 5 for the frames on one side of the tabernacle,

verses.kjv: And five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the sides westward.
verses.ct: 5 for the frames on the other side, and 5 for the frames on the west end at the back.

verses.kjv: And he made the middle bar to shoot through the boards from the one end to the other.
verses.ct: He designed the center crossbar to run through the middle of the frames from one end to the other.

verses.kjv: And he overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold to be places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
verses.ct: He covered the frames with gold, made gold rings to hold the crossbars, and covered the crossbars with gold as well.

verses.kjv: And he made a vail of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: with cherubims made he it of cunning work.
verses.ct: He crafted an inner curtain from blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and finely woven linen, with figures of cherubim skillfully worked into it.

verses.kjv: And he made thereunto four pillars of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold: their hooks were of gold; and he cast for them four sockets of silver.
verses.ct: He made 4 posts of acacia wood for it and covered them with gold. Their hooks were gold, and he cast 4 silver bases for them.

verses.kjv: And he made an hanging for the tabernacle door of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, of needlework;
verses.ct: For the entrance to the tabernacle, he made a screen of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and finely woven linen, decorated with embroidery.

verses.kjv: And the five pillars of it with their hooks: and he overlaid their chapiters and their fillets with gold: but their five sockets were of brass.
verses.ct: He made 5 posts with their hooks for this screen, and covered the tops of the posts and their bands with gold. Their 5 bases were made of bronze.
